revised_title: Electro-Physiological Researches: Tenth Series, Part I
tldr: The author investigates the heat generated by muscle contractions, the electric current in resting muscles, and the phenomenon of induced contraction. He also examines the mechanical effects of muscular contractions and compares them to the work calculated using the dynamical theory of heat. The study suggests that the electric current exciting a muscle does not represent the force exerted by the muscle, which is more likely due to chemical changes during contraction.
